page.title: 03 Morris Dancing
page.content: At Weethley,Morris Dancing has been going for about eleven years.There are about twenty five members in the team, but not all of them dance at every function.Each year,on the first of May, the Morris Dancers do a May Day dance at Weethley church.In 1979 they also danced in South Africa.The Weethley Morris Dancers were the first to dance the dawn in,in England,but only started in 198O. They start dancing at dawn break.This is to welcome the new day in.Between 4O and 6O people turn up to watch this special festival.All the music is traditional.There are dances for the weather,and certain days in the year,and also dances to help the crops grow.The costumes they wear,originally came from the moors.They are coloured red,yellow and green.
